alert.note: Alert for Northern High Plains (Montana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued January 09 at 2:27PM MST until January 11 at 5:00AM MST by NWS GreatFalls
info.description: ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 5 AM MST THURSDAY... ...WIND CHILL ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM NOON WEDNESDAY TO 5 AM MST THURSDAY... * WHAT...For the Winter Weather Advisory, snow. Additional snow accumulations between 2 and 4 inches. Winds gusting between 40 and 60 mph through this evening. For the Wind Chill Advisory, very cold wind chills expected. Wind chills as low as 25 below zero. * WHERE...Northern High Plains. * WHEN...For the Winter Weather Advisory, until 5 AM MST Thursday. For the Wind Chill Advisory, from noon Wednesday to 5 AM MST Thursday. * IMPACTS...Plan on slippery road conditions. Widespread blowing snow could significantly reduce visibility. The dangerously cold wind chills could cause frostbite on exposed skin in as little as 30 minutes. Frostbite and hypothermia are possible if precautions are not taken. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Additional snow and wind chill statements will likely be needed for Thursday and Friday.
info.instruction: Slow down and use caution while traveling. The latest road conditions can be obtained by calling 5 1 1 or visiting the MDT Road Report website. Use caution while traveling outside. Wear appropriate clothing, a hat, and gloves.
